content.question: Which of the following demonstrates oblique motion?

choices.label: Score A has one staff in the treble clef. It has no key signature or time signature and has only one measure consisting of two homophonic chords of two quarter notes each. The pitches in score A are: a chord of A4 and C5, then a chord of G4 and E5.

Score B has one staff in the treble clef. It has no key signature or time signature and has only one measure consisting of two homophonic chords of two quarter notes each. The pitches in score B are: a chord of A4 and C5, then a chord of A4 and E5.

Score C has one staff in the treble clef. It has no key signature or time signature and has only one measure consisting of two homophonic chords of two quarter notes each. The pitches in score C are: a chord of A4 and C5, then a chord of B4 and G5.

Score D has one staff in the treble clef. It has no key signature or time signature and has only one measure consisting of two homophonic chords of two quarter notes each. The pitches in score D are: a chord of A4 and C5, then a chord of B4 and D5.

content.answer: Score B has one staff in the treble clef. It has no key signature or time signature and has only one measure consisting of two homophonic chords of two quarter notes each. The pitches in score B are: a chord of A4 and C5, then a chord of A4 and E5.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in notated music.
